hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Muhammad al-Absī: Ibn Abi Ubaydah narrated to us, he said: My father narrated to us, from al-A'mash, from al-Alaa ibn Badr, from Tamim ibn Hudhalam, who said: 'I attained Abu Bakr and Umar and the Companions of Muhammad ﷺ. So I did not see anyone more ascetic in this world, nor more desirous of the Hereafter, nor would I have loved to be in his state like Abdullah ibn Mas'ud.' And Amr ibn Abbas said: Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us, from one who is not the son of al-Rabi', Rakin al-Dabi, who heard Tamim ibn Hudhalam, and he was from the Companions of Abdullah.

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad al-Absī
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Absī

narrators.name: Tamim ibn Hudhalam
narrators.full_name: Tamim ibn Hudhalam ibn Umayyah al-Dabi

chainIssues: Chain begins with majhul narrator (Abdullah ibn Muhammad al-Absī)
Next two narrators (Ibn Abi Ubaydah and his father) are majhul al-hal or majhul
Al-A'mash is a known mudallis (category 2) using indirect term 'an - generally acceptable given his reliability
Al-Alaa ibn Badr is saduq yahim with weak memory
Multiple weak links in succession reduce overall chain strength

narrators.name: Amr ibn Abbas

potential_issues.issue: Al-Alaa ibn Badr is weak in memory

potential_issues.issue: Second chain also compromised by majhul narrators

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Musaddad: From Abu al-Ahwas, from al-Mughirah, from Ibrahim, Tamim ibn Hudhayim al-Dabi said: 'I read before Abdullah.' And Ahmad ibn Yunus said: 'Muhammad ibn Abd al-Aziz narrated to us, from al-Mughirah, from Ibrahim, he said: Tamim ibn Hudhayim read before Abdullah, then he recited al-Sajdah (the Prostration chapter). And Ibn Tahman said: From al-Mughirah, from al-Zuhri, from Tamim ibn Hudhayim, I read before Abdullah.'

chainIssues: Al-Mughirah is a known mudallis using indirect term 'an, though he is generally reliable
Chain structure is clear with mostly reliable narrators
Al-Mughirah is a known mudallis using indirect term 'an
Despite mudallis nature, al-Mughirah remains generally reliable

narrators.name: al-Zuhri

chainIssues: Both al-Mughirah and al-Zuhri are known mudallis using indirect terms

potential_issues.issue: Al-Mughirah appears in multiple chains as a mudallis using 'an
potential_issues.impact: Though al-Mughirah is generally reliable, his mudallis nature (Category 1-2) with indirect term creates some ambiguity. However, given his overall reliability this is not severely problematic

potential_issues.issue: Al-Zuhri is a Category 3 mudallis using indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: Al-Zuhri's status as a more problematic mudallis (Category 3) using 'an when narrating from Tamim ibn Hudhayim (a Successor) introduces uncertainty about direct transmission

potential_issues.issue: Third chain has dual mudallis concern
potential_issues.impact: Presence of both al-Mughirah and al-Zuhri, both using indirect terms, creates compound weak points in the transmission
